comments.body:
"Huh"

    -Villager
This is a simple way that adds alotta life to the the game without unbalancing it. I appreciate the idea! Never thought of it before myself. Good work!
It would be cool if they also had a camp villages on mountains, great idea!

Not bad, maybe it is just a camp with tents made out of wool and chests contain: 1 - 2 goat horns 1 - 3 raw mutton, 1 - 5 icicles (see A variant of Stalactites in cold biomes: Icicles! – Minecraft Feedback). You have a vote.
Villagers living on trees in the jungle.
Good :D idea
It's annoying, since they added in swamp and jungle villager textures but said they didn't want to add in swamp and jungle villages.  Maybe this post will help Mojang change their mind.
Why not make musician villagers singing ? ;)
He could be a Travelling Bard
Bard! Bard! Bard! Bard! Bard!!!!
I was just about to put this as an idea then I saw yours, I agree.

Yes please! I would love a beekeeper villager!

They can bring new bees to new apiaries. They can buy and sell all sorts of honey products and flowers. Higher level, you could maybe buy a bee nest itself?
how could Mojang not see people wanting bee keepers for villager jobs? Come on man
I had the same idea and posted it

First tier trade could be honey combs for emeralds and then emeralds for flowers

second tier trade could be honey bottles for emeralds then emeralds for bottles

third tier trade could be honey blocks for emeralds then emeralds for sheers

fourth tier trade could be (if they added in bee jelly) jelly bottles for emeralds then emeralds for campfire

final trade could be jelly blocks for emeralds then emeralds for beehive
They should be able to harvest honey too, but the generated bee hive structure should have campfire below it
i was literally just about to post this

One with Illagers.

And the second one is a city with the regular villagers and new type of humanoid mobs that defends the city. It would be great and better if the new mobs (hunters, guards, etc) would kinda look like the player.
Just make the more war-like medieval villages home to some pillagers, witches, and, rarely, a vindicator.
I should say if you can't find it, the Tropical Islands post isn't around, sorry :|

Here's a concept design I created for a possible Tropical Village for the Island Natives or Villagers

(this would be on the coast of Tropical Islands, I've built this one in a jungle so I didn't have to build an entire island)
More images of the buildings and new building concept designs are available by request if people are interested
Please show more pictures!!!!!!!!!!!
I would like the natives to live in tents as I find it better. Just an idea.
I should apologize, I kept trying to send more pictures but it didn't work every time

I find it weird that they have to be evil. The native Americans were not dangerous. Can they be like villagers but maybe when attacked by a monster they take out spears kind of like how a vindicator takes out its axe?

I should say Steve, I wasn't referring to Native Americans or any specific tribe, and my thought was that some very remote tribes do attack strangers who they see as a threat.

I am not saying they are always like that however, and therefore I have left all three possible standings with the player open to debate

Thank you for your comment though
This is so good. This give an exclusive feature to the game. I'm voting for this idea.

I really like this, I even had a concept including the other illagers as well. I think giving another twist to this game would be great. Being a "Hero" all the time gets boring. I want an Illager army so bad.

It should be if you attach an illager banner to your armor and they only do that if you wear the banner. Then all illagers that see you do it and adding that banner to another banner makes them listen to your banner

New item: ominous shield, it is a shield with an illager banner pattern on it. It will make all illagers neutral. You would be able to level up your illager rank by killing stuff to show your skill. If you raise your rank high enough, you can ride ravagers, and if you max out your rank, you can actually lead the raids. As your rank goes up, your reputation in villages goes down, and vice versa. If you are holding an ominous shield, then villagers will run away from you and iron golems will attack you. There would be no way to get the totem of undying. (That is the trade-off, besides, you have to use the ominous shield to raise your rank anyways.)

If you die holding the ominous shield, your rank cannot go any higher than it was at that point. (it can still go down, and it can return to that point, it just can't go higher.)

While I love this, I honestly think giving the pillagers the ability to follow you would be unfair since the villagers don't really "do" anything for the player anyway, and this would cause chaos on multiplayer servers as anyone who didn't have the shield would be attacked on sight. No way mojang would encourage attacking villagers.

Pillagers should still aggro you no matter what, but maybe implement a way to create an uneasy alliance with illagers in mansions, who sell you all the evil stuff, since you travelled all that way to see them. Harming potions, tipped arrows, totems, books, crossbows, only cursed tools and armor, fermented spider eye...nothing to help you eat, heal or build with, just dangerous and cursed items, and junk. They could maybe try to cheat or scam you on occasion and be kind of unreliable. Looting from the mansion causes them to aggro you. There should be at least one exclusive item from trading with them (maybe maps to other villages lol). Making a trading hall should be possible, with the caveat that if they die, that's it, as they don't respawn.

This mechanic should be as simple as how wearing gold armor is enough to stop pigmen from aggroing you. Wearing something else should be enough, or holding something in your off hand.

This way the player can interact with the Illagers without having to be "evil", still enjoy the Pillager mechanics, it doesn't abuse the Villagers or grief other players, and it fleshes out these relatively new mobs and mansion.
mabey allow you to learn spells from the evokers or ride ravagers

Maybe do something more rare and seemingly better, like there is only one 'magic forest biome' each world. Making finding one, much, much more rewarding than if there are multiple. That way, there is only one 'Rana' per world.
Bring back frog girl!
In my opinion, Rana should be added as a New Minecraft Default Skin, along with Merl and the Glasses Guy from Minecraft Earth.

Related - https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360052274411-pilgins-ride-pilgin-beasts-hogs

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360052530992-Ride-the-Piglin-Beast

Good luck with your suggestion!
That was in the village and pillage trailer so I think it should be in the game it would be really cute seeing a baby Villiger riding a pig
Uh... Do you mean add zombie piglins?
Gryogon yeah that's what it sounds like

The floppy ears feel like they belong in the game.

The Zombie Pigman has just wrong texture to them, it's too different from Piglin texture.
I like the ears though. Zombified piglins will hopefully having a slightly different texture from zombie pigmen
No quiero que se vean como piglin me gusta que sigan siendo hombre cerdo
Just please have the old zombie pigman back.
I like the facet that it has only one ear. They are zombified and ears are not made of bone so it makes sense that the other side has no ear. The point is for it to be like that.
Good Idea

I like this idea, generally making the villagers have more personality would be nice.

"Loner" should only aply to the Nitwit (green robed) It also should not gather at town centers during the afternoon.
389659035511, no, I am a loner but I am the smartest in my class, loners should have good trades and not be nitwits
Gintoki Gintoki That is offensive to people like me and Manasa Miller! We may be loners but we aren’t idiots! We’re in fact smarter than most people.

Moved excess information from header. 

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
join Minecraft today
Omg
Farmer is a villager, moving to proper category. Thanks for your contribution.

I was going to give feedback about the frequency of this trade occuring, but I realised this would have to be extremely, extremely rare for it to not be easily exploitable, using villager farms, just buying the apple once, and getting rid of the villager, getting the next.
So, I am going to suggest a 1 in 200 chance that a farmer has the trade, so just seeing one feels harder than finding a wither skull, discouraging farms for this.
Also, I would not have it be restockable, being too rare to obtain again.
Definitely would be a master tier exclusive selling but I think it should still be restockable for only a few times and can still be reset also it will be a very expensive item to buy.
What about gnomes, they will be funny to see
Sounds very interesting. What would it look like?
An aquatic villager who can trade prismarine, trident, sea lanterns, all the blocks that have to do with water, etc.
You just explained a Farmer.
I mean like flowers, bonemeal , vines etc.
That is literally what a farmer does.  I do not understand the dye part at all.

They are just like farmers.How about they trade flowers, berry bushes and tree spalings rather than agricultural items such as crop seeds.Farmers can trade crops.So there's no need to have a new Villager to trade crops and seeds.All we need is a villager that can actually trade gardening items.Remember gardeners are not farmers.Im fine with the flowers and trees but not the crops.Please re-edit your statement and add more details to become more understandable.Its a good idea but luck of details.
The dyes part ia covered by a shepherd

Workstation block - large pot

Sell: pots, flower, tree plants, large pots, bone meal
I think it is a good idea.
Well we already have the phantom, what more do we need to give to the enderman? They have teleportation powers, and giving them wings just doesnt seem like they would still be called enderman
You can't wear an Un Carved Pumpkin!
This makes no sense.
Why would an Enderman with Phantom wings even exist? The two don't have a relationship.
Yeah and maybe different systems could have different trades
Please vote for it.
Except for spawning new Villagers and Villages, you have basically just described Minecraft Legends, which already exists (and sadly is no longer being updated 😔)
Have you forgotten about the “Villagers are pacifists and will stay that way” rule?

I guess wood working station would be nice, however instead of anvil for wood, that I dont know what should be for based on description, wood cutter/station could work similarly as stone cutter but for wooden blocks, letting you make stairs 1:1 of wooden planks, letting you stripping logs without placing one by one and using axe would be nice too, for building it is fine but since we need them for crafting hanging signs, it can be rather annoying to place 6+ logs, stripe them and then mine them again any time you want to use any hanging sign
wood working villager could buy logs of different biom his village is from (plain villager would not buy oak but could buy any other wood) in high quantities (about same as stone is bought by other villagers) and sell different wooden products as doors, striped logs, planks and such of wood from his biom, while desert villager be then more lacking on selling part, he could have more buying offers in return, making those possibly most valuable for regular player
they could be even coded smarter and just take closest tree-containing biom and offer logs from there, however it would require them work quite differently than original or biom-specific villagers and could not work well, as well as implying villagers venture possibly far from village if it isnt at edge of biom

other similar profession could be glass worker with kiln or glass cutter, kiln could smelt glass faster or glass cutter letting you make glass panes in it
Well, they can’t make too many mobs attack Villagers. That would make Villagers nigh on impossible to protect. That’s probably why they limited it to Zombies and Illagers. Good arguments, though.
The Pale Garden isn't very dry, but it certainly seems like something has been drained from it.
I know, I just think cloaked mobs would look better than the normal zombies. Overall, I would prefer completely new variants for the pale garden.. I think I'll get onto that now
OK, but what special thing do they do?
Sorry for the late response! I made a post on the improved version, the Thrall, which inflicts temporary darkness on the player so the Creaking can get closer
